Package nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.util

Class Util

java.lang.Object
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.util.Util
public final class Util extends Object
Represents various small and platform-agnostic utility functions.
Author:
Pim

    • requireNonNull

      @Contract("null, _ -> fail") public static <T> T requireNonNull(@Nullable T obj, String name) throws NullPointerException
      Ensures an object is not null.

      If the object is null after all, a NullPointerException will be thrown.

      This is basically the same as Objects.requireNonNull(Object, String) with the only difference being that this will create a full "must not be null" message for the provided variable name.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the input object.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to check.
      name - The name of the input object. This is used in the NPE message with the format "{name} must not be null!".
      Returns:
      The input object, if it is not null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the input object to check is null.

    • getDistanceToStructure

      public static double getDistanceToStructure(IPlayer player, IStructureConst structure)
      See getDistanceToStructure(ILocation, IStructureConst).

      If the player object has no location, -2 is returned.

    • getDistanceToStructure

      public static double getDistanceToStructure(ILocation location, IStructureConst structure)
      Gets the distance between a location and a structure. If the location and the structure are not in the same world, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      location - The location to check.
      structure - The structure to check.
      Returns:
      The distance between the location and the structure if they lie in the same world, otherwise -1.

    • valOrDefault

      public static <T> T valOrDefault(@Nullable T value, Supplier<T> fallback)
      Gets a NotNull value from a Nullable one, with a provided fallback in case the value is null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the value.
      Parameters:
      value - The value that may or may not be null.
      fallback - A Supplier to supply a fallback to return in case the value is null.
      Returns:
      The value if it is not null, otherwise the fallback.

    • searchIterable

      public static <T> Optional<T> searchIterable(Iterable<T> iterable, Predicate<T> searchPred)
      Searches through an Iterable object using a provided search function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of objects stored in the Iterable.
      Parameters:
      iterable - The Iterable object to search through.
      searchPred - The search predicate to use.
      Returns:
      The value in the Iterable object for which the search function returns true, otherwise Optional.empty().

    • isValidStructureName

      public static boolean isValidStructureName(@Nullable @Nullable String name)
      Check if a given string is a valid structure name. The following input is not allowed:

      - Numerical names (numerical values are reserved for UIDs).

      - Empty input.

      - Input containing spaces.

      Parameters:
      name - The name to test for validity,
      Returns:
      True if the name is allowed.

    • getChunkId

      public static long getChunkId(Vector2Di chunkCoords)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The ID of the chunk.

    • getChunkId

      public static long getChunkId(int chunkX, int chunkZ)
      Gets the ID of the chunk from its coordinates.

      The upper 32 bits store the x-coordinate of the chunk, and the lower 32 bits store the z coordinate.

      Parameters:
      chunkX - The x-coordinate of the chunk.
      chunkZ - The z-coordinate of the chunk.
      Returns:
      The ID of the chunk.

    • getChunkFromId

      public static Vector2Di getChunkFromId(long chunkId)
      Retrieves the chunk coordinates from the chunk's ID. See getChunkId(Vector2Di).
      Parameters:
      chunkId - The ID of the chunk.
      Returns:
      The x/z coordinates of the chunk.

    • simpleChunkSpaceLocationHash

      public static int simpleChunkSpaceLocationHash(int x, int y, int z)
      Gets the 'simple' hash of a location in chunk-space. 'simple' here refers to the fact that the world of this location will not be taken into account.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the location.
      y - The z-coordinate of the location.
      z - The z-coordinate of the location.
      Returns:
      The simple hash of the location in chunk-space.

    • between

      public static boolean between(int test, int low, int high)
      Check if a given value is between two other values. Matches inclusively.
      Parameters:
      test - Value to be compared.
      low - Minimum value.
      high - Maximum value.
      Returns:
      True if the value is in the provided range or if it equals the low and/or the high value.

    • getAllCompletableFutureResults

      public static <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> getAllCompletableFutureResults(Collection<CompletableFuture<T>> futures)
      See getAllCompletableFutureResults(CompletableFuture[]).

    • getAllCompletableFutureResults

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> getAllCompletableFutureResults(CompletableFuture<T>... futures)
      Maps a group of CompletableFutures to a single CompletableFuture with a list of results.

      The result will wait for each of the futures to complete and once all of them have completed gather the results and return the list.

      Each entry in the list maps to the result of a single future.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of data.
      Parameters:
      futures - The completable futures whose results to collect into a list.
      Returns:
      The list of results obtained from the CompletableFutures in the same order as provided. The list will have a size that matches the number of input futures.

    • getAllCompletableFutureResultsFlatMap

      public static <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> getAllCompletableFutureResultsFlatMap(Collection<CompletableFuture<? extends Collection<T>>> futures)
      See getAllCompletableFutureResultsFlatMap(CompletableFuture[]).

    • getAllCompletableFutureResultsFlatMap

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> getAllCompletableFutureResultsFlatMap(CompletableFuture<? extends Collection<T>>... futures)
      Maps a group of CompletableFutures that each have a list as result to a single CompletableFuture with a list.

      The result will wait for each of the futures to complete and once all of them have completed gather the results and return the list.

      The results of the futures are flatMapped into a single list.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of data in the lists.
      Parameters:
      futures - The completable futures whose results to flatMap into a list.
      Returns:
      The list of results obtained from the CompletableFutures.

    • exceptionally

      @Contract("_, !null -> !null") @Nullable public static <T> T exceptionally(Throwable throwable, @Nullable T fallback)
      Logs a throwable and returns a fallback value.

      Mostly useful for CompletableFuture.exceptionally(Function).

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the fallback value.
      Parameters:
      throwable - The throwable to send to the logger.
      fallback - The fallback value to return.
      Returns:
      The fallback value.

    • exceptionally

      @Nullable public static <T> T exceptionally(Throwable throwable)
      See exceptionally(Throwable, Object) with a null fallback value.
      Returns:
      Always null

    • exceptionallyOptional

      public static <T> Optional<T> exceptionallyOptional(Throwable throwable)
      See exceptionally(Throwable, Object) with a fallback value of Optional.empty().
      Returns:
      Always Optional.empty().

    • exceptionallyList

      public static <T> List<T> exceptionallyList(Throwable throwable)
      See exceptionally(Throwable, Object) with a fallback value of Collections.emptyList().
      Returns:
      Always Collections.emptyList().

    • exceptionallyCompletion

      public static <T, U> T exceptionallyCompletion(Throwable throwable, T fallback, CompletableFuture<U> target)
      Handles exceptional completion of a CompletableFuture. This ensures that the target is finished exceptionally as well, to propagate the exception.
      Parameters:
      throwable - The Throwable to log.
      fallback - The fallback value to return.
      target - The CompletableFuture to complete.
      Returns:
      The fallback value.

    • exceptionallyCompletion

      public static <T> Void exceptionallyCompletion(Throwable throwable, CompletableFuture<T> target)
      Handles exceptional completion of a CompletableFuture. This ensures that the target is finished exceptionally as well, to propagate the exception.
      Parameters:
      throwable - The Throwable to log.
      target - The CompletableFuture to complete.
      Returns:
      Always null;

    • parseLogLevelStrict

      @Nullable public static @Nullable Level parseLogLevelStrict(@Nullable @Nullable String logLevelName)
      Parses the Level from its name.

      The strict refers to the aspect that only name matches are allowed. See Level.getName(). Contrary to Level.parse(String), this method won't define new levels from integer inputs.

      Parameters:
      logLevelName - The name of the log level.
      Returns:
      The Level if an exact match could be found, otherwise null.

    • sortAlphabetically

      public static <T> void sortAlphabetically(List<T> list, Function<T,String> mapper)
